revised_title: Iron Analysis in Thymic Cortex Cells of Weaver-Birds
tldr: The study analyzed the presence of iron in cells of the thymic cortex of a weaver-bird using the EMMA-4 analytical electron microscope. The results showed that pale cells, which are early erythroid cells, had lower iron counts than mature cells. This indicates that these cells are in the early stages of erythropoiesis, supporting the theory that erythropoiesis occurs in situ in the avian thymus.
